llm.feedback: Your draft is a solid start but still falls short of a world‑class 3–6‑month thesis.  First, add the hard numbers that anchor the story: 300 M households, Q2 2025 revenue $11.1 B (15.9 % YoY) and free cash flow $8.5 B (61SVFUKBY).  Quantify the ad‑tier and password‑crack adoption curves—target 20 % of subscribers by Q4 2025, 25 % by 2026, and link each to incremental revenue ($1–1.5 B) and churn reduction (~5 % YoY).  Bring in macro drivers: Fed funds 5.25‑5.5 % through 2026, inflation easing, and the streaming‑share shift (Netflix 8.8 % U.S. TV time vs. YouTube 10 %+).  For valuation, cite analyst consensus that P/E will compress to 35–40× by 2030 (61SVFUKBY, A88B7V8PY) and model a 10–15 % compression in 12–18 mo if earnings slow.  Build a clear scenario map: base case (20 % ad‑tier, 12 % international growth, $18 B spend), upside (25 % ad‑tier, 15 % growth), downside (30 % spend overrun, 10 % subscriber loss).  List watch signals: Q3 earnings guidance, password‑crack churn metrics, ad‑tier revenue share, content‑spend‑vs‑revenue ratio.  Finally, give a confidence rating (moderate‑high) and note the thesis hinges on ad‑tier uptake and password‑crack efficacy.  Ensure every claim is backed by a source ID (e.g., 61SVFUKBY, A88B7V8PY).
